title: Buff idea to Nunu R, Galio R, Fiddlesticks R, and Karthus R
body:
While they are channeling instead of all the mana being drained on cast it drains over the duration of the channel.

How is this a buff you might ask? When these champs get their ults interrupted it feels like absolute shit as they just spent a ton of mana for almost nothing. 

Example of how it would work: Karthus channels his ult over 3.5 seconds. The mana cost is 150 and is drained during the channel duration meaning if he gets interrupted he doesnt lose the entire mana cost from his pool.

Edit: You would need the full amount of mana required for the spell to cast it.

replies.body: I could get behind this idea for Nunu/Galio as they are meant to channel in the middle of teams, but not Fidd or Karthus. Those two _should_ be punished for poor positioning when deciding to ult. Especially Karthus- he doesn't have to be anywhere close to the enemy team for his ult to be effective, and already gets a mana-free ult if he dies in a fight with it up.

This. If Karth and Fid get interrupted, then they positioned badly. 

I think that the draining mana could be interesting, but I don't know if that would be right for buffing these champs. Personally, I think if we were looking to buff these champs, then looking outside of their ult Mana costs would bring more to the table (as mana isn't really a huge pain point for these channeling champs anyway, as they usually use ult early in a fight or build mana). I would also argue that Nunu and Galio get value out of their ults even if they get interrupted. They both still get the initial disruption and damage.
What's the harm in a QOL change for Galio and nunu though? I suspect this wouldn't be a huge buff anyways to push them into OP. Ya feel me?

No, its more of a gameplay buff because it isn't in any way a QOL change. A QOL change has no direct impact on actual gameplay, this would directly change when and how your mana is spent when using your ultimate. An example of a QOL change is your teammates can see if your summoner spells are up or not.
They called Azir's Shurima shuffle a QOL change. All they did was allow you to Q and E at the same time and now this whole new mechanic has become core to his kit.

Oh he's strong, but could use a little better mana management.

Honestly the change Galio needs to tide him over for a rework of some sort (probably on the scale of the MYMU/Marksman etc.) is to just get rid of his passive and give his abilities MR scaling since there is really no reason for him to have that passive. It's like if we removed Taric's passive and made him gain AP for getting Armor while no longer having any Armor scaling.

The passive feels like just straight up stats the can be just thrown into the base kit and open up room for an actual passive. Also, it's not like Galio's kit has the risk of being overloaded unless we give him a gap closer since as it is his kit has no idea what it wants to be since he CAN burst and he CAN tank, but he is just so subpar at both (no real CC if he is a tank and can kind of just be ignored and is super squishy if he goes AP while also running into big mana problems if he is trying to poke people with his eye blasts).
What needs to happen is halve the AP scaling on the W heal, and make it do %max health healing too. No one builds glass cannon galio anyway. It could even me % missing health.
If mana is out the door how does reducing Karthus R cool down for late game sound?
God no please. It's an undodgeable spell that will half health carries late game.

Nunu is desperately in need of a buff. He's been one of the lowest performing champions in every lane for months now. The E change on the PBE is quite honestly, just sad. It is situationally a nerf and the changes are probably more bad than good over all. The best thing Nunu could do lategame was buff the ADC for 12 seconds. 

Could you keep the lowered cooldown and mana cost and get rid of the duration nerf? Even with a pure buff I doubt he'd even scrape together a 50% winrate. It'd be cool to be able to buff multiple allies at once. It's an interesting niche but the buff is so small it wouldn't be overpowered at all.

if you don't have enough mana to fulfill the overall mana requirement, what happens? ie) Ult costs 100 mana but you only have 50 (and won't regen in time). What if Fiddles has 150 mana, he ults + uses silence, and now he no longer has enough mana to sustain the full duration of the ult. Would his ult just stop then? None of these abilities are toggles, so it wouldn't make sense. Besides, you're taking a risk to make a big play. Getting interrupted was a mistake on your part.

Maybe their ults could use buffs, but I don't agree with this one.

If you didn't have the mana for the full cost before beginning to use the ability, you wouldn't be able to cast it. It's the exact same as before, except the mana cost of the ability spreads out evenly over time throughout the channel duration, rather than losing everything at the start.

It's not talking about when Fidd is dealing the damage. It's referring to the channel before his AoE takes effect when he is unable to do anything else. By the time the AoE takes effect, his full mana cost for his ult will have been used. It would obviously require you to have all the mana to begin with, but drain it over the duration of the channel before execution. It would only really make a difference if Fidd was hard cc'ed before finishing his channel. It would be rather useful though if you were nearly out of mana and the lack of full mana cost when cc'ed allowed you to Q and escape from the potential threat of your attacker.
